properties.name: Hoover Dam
properties.serves: Las Vegas, Los Angeles, Phoenix, Tucson
properties.impact_description: Controls flow to Lower Colorado River; major downstream reduction. Lake Mead has declined dramatically due to drought and over-allocation.
properties.connected_infrastructure: Central Arizona Project, Colorado River Aqueduct, All-American Canal

properties.name: Glen Canyon Dam
properties.serves: Phoenix, Tucson, Las Vegas, Los Angeles, San Diego
properties.impact_description: Major flow regulation; feeds Lake Mead and Lower Basin. Lake Powell has reached critically low levels, threatening power generation.
properties.connected_infrastructure: Central Arizona Project, Colorado River Aqueduct

properties.name: Roosevelt Dam
properties.serves: Phoenix, Mesa, Tempe, Scottsdale
properties.impact_description: Salt River runs dry downstream; water diverted to Phoenix metro via Salt River Project canals.

properties.name: Davis Dam
properties.serves: Bullhead City, Laughlin
properties.impact_description: Regulates flow from Hoover Dam; afterbay for power generation and downstream distribution.

properties.name: Parker Dam
properties.serves: Phoenix, Tucson, Los Angeles, San Diego
properties.impact_description: Diverts to CAP and Colorado River Aqueduct; major extraction point for Southern California and Arizona.
properties.connected_infrastructure: Central Arizona Project, Colorado River Aqueduct

properties.name: Imperial Dam
properties.serves: Imperial Valley, Yuma, Coachella Valley
properties.impact_description: Diverts to All-American Canal and Gila Gravity Main Canal; near-total extraction of remaining Colorado flow.
properties.connected_infrastructure: All-American Canal, Gila Gravity Main Canal

properties.name: Shasta Dam
properties.serves: Sacramento, San Francisco Bay Area, Central Valley
properties.impact_description: Regulates Sacramento River flow; cornerstone of California State Water Project and Central Valley irrigation.

properties.name: Oroville Dam
properties.serves: Sacramento, San Francisco Bay Area, Southern California
properties.impact_description: Tallest dam in the US. Major California water project storage; supplies State Water Project. Emergency spillway failure in 2017 prompted evacuation of 188,000 people.

properties.name: Flaming Gorge Dam
properties.serves: Salt Lake City region, downstream Colorado River system
properties.impact_description: Regulates Green River flow into Colorado River system; critical for downstream water balance.

properties.name: Navajo Dam
properties.serves: Farmington, Navajo Nation
properties.impact_description: Regulates San Juan River, a major tributary to the Colorado River. Supports irrigation in the San Juan Basin.

properties.name: Elephant Butte Dam
properties.serves: El Paso, Las Cruces, Albuquerque
properties.impact_description: Rio Grande often runs dry downstream; irrigation diversions serve both US and Mexico. Oldest and largest dam on the Rio Grande.

properties.name: Morelos Dam
properties.serves: Mexicali Valley (Mexico)
properties.impact_description: Last diversion before Colorado River delta; the river rarely reaches the ocean. Symbol of transboundary water crisis.

properties.name: Grand Coulee Dam
properties.serves: Pacific Northwest power grid, irrigation in eastern Washington
properties.impact_description: Largest hydroelectric facility in the US. Completely blocked salmon migration upstream — no fish ladder installed. Major ecological impact on Pacific salmon populations.
properties.connected_infrastructure: Columbia River power grid, irrigation canals

properties.name: Bonneville Dam
properties.serves: Portland, Seattle — Pacific Northwest power grid
properties.impact_description: First major dam on the Columbia River. Fish ladders were installed and are among the most successful in the US, allowing salmon passage.

properties.name: Chief Joseph Dam
properties.serves: Pacific Northwest power grid
properties.impact_description: Second largest hydroelectric dam in the US. No fish passage facilities — blocks salmon migration for the upper Columbia River basin.

properties.name: Dworshak Dam
properties.serves: Boise region, downstream flow augmentation for salmon
properties.impact_description: Tallest dam in Idaho. Water releases are used to augment flow in the Snake River to help juvenile salmon migrate to the ocean.

properties.name: Norris Dam
properties.serves: Knoxville, eastern Tennessee — TVA power grid
properties.impact_description: First dam built by the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA). Transformed the region's economy through flood control, power generation, and recreation.
properties.connected_infrastructure: TVA power grid, Tennessee River system

properties.name: Wheeler Dam
properties.serves: Northern Alabama — Huntsville, TVA power grid
properties.impact_description: Major TVA dam providing flood control and power. Reservoir hosts significant wildlife habitat and is an important recreational resource.
properties.connected_infrastructure: TVA power grid, Tennessee River navigation

properties.name: Chickamauga Dam
properties.serves: Chattanooga, eastern Tennessee — TVA power grid
properties.impact_description: TVA dam creating one of the largest reservoirs in the Southeast. Supports navigation, flood control, and significant recreational tourism.
properties.connected_infrastructure: TVA power grid, Tennessee River navigation

properties.name: Garrison Dam
properties.serves: North Dakota, downstream Missouri River states
properties.impact_description: Creates Lake Sakakawea, the 4th largest man-made reservoir in the US. Flooded significant lands of the Three Affiliated Nations (Mandan, Hidatsa, Arikara). Major controversy over tribal displacement.

properties.name: Oahe Dam
properties.serves: South Dakota, downstream Missouri system
properties.impact_description: Creates Lake Oahe, the largest reservoir on the Missouri River. Flooded lands of the Crow Creek and Lower Brule reservations. Standing Rock Sioux water rights remain a major legal dispute (Dakota Access Pipeline controversy).

properties.name: Fort Randall Dam
properties.serves: Pierre, South Dakota
properties.impact_description: Part of the Pick-Sloan Missouri Basin Program. Provides flood control, power, and irrigation for central South Dakota.

properties.name: Kinzua Dam
properties.serves: Bradford, PA — flood control and water supply
properties.impact_description: Highly controversial — flooded ancestral Seneca Nation lands protected by the Treaty of 1832. Became a symbol of the conflict between federal infrastructure and Native American land rights. Damaged by a tornado in 2003.

properties.name: Conowingo Dam
properties.serves: Baltimore, Philadelphia — power grid
properties.impact_description: Traps massive amounts of sediment from upstream, degrading Chesapeake Bay water quality. Major source of nutrient pollution in the Bay. Blocks fish migration on the Susquehanna.

properties.name: Falcon Dam
properties.serves: Laredo, Eagle Pass — border region water supply
properties.impact_description: Joint US-Mexico dam on the Rio Grande. Dramatically reduced river flow downstream, contributing to the Rio Grande drying up before reaching the Gulf of Mexico.
properties.connected_infrastructure: Rio Grande, US-Mexico water treaty infrastructure

properties.name: New Melones Dam
properties.serves: Stockton, Modesto — Central Valley irrigation
properties.impact_description: Submerged historic gold mining sites and Native American artifacts. Reservoir has frequently been drawn down to near-empty during drought years to meet Central Valley irrigation demands.
properties.connected_infrastructure: Central Valley Project, California irrigation system

properties.name: San Luis Dam
properties.serves: Central Valley, Southern California — off-stream storage
properties.impact_description: Largest off-stream reservoir in the US — stores water pumped from the Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta and Colorado River. Critical link in California's water transfer system.
properties.connected_infrastructure: California Aqueduct, Delta-Mendota Canal, State Water Project

properties.name: Ozark Dam
properties.serves: Fort Smith, Little Rock — navigation and flood control
properties.impact_description: Part of the Arkansas River Navigation System enabling barge traffic from the Mississippi to Tulsa. Provides flood protection for downstream communities.
properties.connected_infrastructure: Arkansas River Navigation System, Mississippi River

properties.name: Bagnell Dam
properties.serves: Jefferson City, Columbia — power and recreation
properties.impact_description: Creates Lake of the Ozarks, one of Missouri's largest lakes and a major tourism and recreational destination. Privately operated — one of the few large dams built by a utility company rather than the federal government.

metadata.source: Compiled from USGS, Bureau of Reclamation, TVA, Army Corps of Engineers, and public dam records
metadata.description: Major water infrastructure dams across the United States
